creator: rbargezi@infonic.net
text: The Results Tree has a nice "Scroll automatically" feature. Why not add this to the Summary Report?

creator: rbargezi@infonic.net
text:
Created attachment 27750
Proposed enhancement as a patch to Revision 905023 of SummaryReport.java

Is it really needed for the Summary Report?

Besides, new samples don't get added in order, only the labels are added in order of first appearance.

==

By the way, although patches are welcome, please only change the minimum necessary to implement a new feature. The proposed patch contains lots of irrelevant changes to spacing etc. which make it difficult to review.
creator: sebb@apache.org
rbargezi@infonic.net
text:
Sebb,

On the patches: I try very hard not to create tons of irrelevant stuff in them, but it seem I cannot get eclipse to do so. In my comparison views I do though only see the differences I introduced.

Do you guys have any formatters you use? this would fix the issue.

On the request: I simply think its nice to see the totals rather than having to scroll. And typically I would have my labels be generated so they are actually added to the end of the list.
